intro: Reissantia angustipetala var. boinensis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved reissantia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
